metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1690 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The help function in net/netfilter/nf_nat_irc.c in the Linux kernel before3.12.8 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from kernelmemory by establishing an IRC DCC session in which incorrect packet data istransmitted during use of the NAT mangle feature.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1690` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-3-generic - 3.13.0-3.18
linux-image-3.13.0-3-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-3.18
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-3-generic - 3.13.0-3.18
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-3.18').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-utopic package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1').
linux-lts-wily package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-18.22~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
